Source file src/github.com/haraldrudell/parl/log.go

Documentation: github.com/haraldrudell/parl 

     1  /*

     5  
     6  package parl
     7  
     8  const (
     9  	logStackFramesToSkip = 1
    10  )
    11  
    12  var stderrLogger = newLog(nil, logStackFramesToSkip)
    13  
    14  // Out prints extected output to stdout
    15  func Out(format string, a ...interface{}) {
    16  	stdoutOutput(0, sprintf(format, a))
    17  }
    18  
    19  // Log invocations always print
    20  // if debug is enabled, code location is appended
    21  func Log(format string, a ...interface{}) {
    22  	stderrLogger.Log(format, a...)
    23  }
    24  
    25  // Console always print intended for command-line interactivity
    26  // if debug is enabled, code location is appended
    27  func Console(format string, a ...interface{}) {
    28  	stderrLogger.Log(format, a...)
    29  }
    30  
    31  // Info prints unless silence has been configured with SetSilence(true)
    32  // IsSilent deteremines the state of silence
    33  // if debug is enabled, code location is appended
    34  func Info(format string, a ...interface{}) {
    35  	stderrLogger.Info(format, a...)
    36  }
    37  
    38  // Debug outputs only if debug is configured or the code location package matches regexp
    39  func Debug(format string, a ...interface{}) {
    40  	stderrLogger.Debug(format, a...)
    41  }
    42  
    43  // IsThisDebug returns whether debug logging is configured for the executing function
    44  func IsThisDebug() bool {
    45  	return stderrLogger.IsThisDebug()
    46  }
    47  
    48  // IsSilent if true it means that Info does not print
    49  func IsSilent() (isSilent bool) {
    50  	return stderrLogger.IsSilent()
    51  }
    52  
    53  func SetRegexp(regExp string) (err error) {
    54  	return stderrLogger.SetRegexp(regExp)
    55  }
    56  
    57  // SetSilent
    58  func SetSilent(silent bool) {
    59  	stderrLogger.SetSilent(silent)
    60  }
    61  
    62  // if SetDebug is true, all Debug prints everywhere produce output.
    63  // More selective debug printing can be achieved using SetInfoRegexp that matches package names.
    64  func SetDebug(debug bool) {
    65  	stderrLogger.SetDebug(debug)
    66  }
    67  
    68  // D prints to stderr with code location
    69  // Thread safe. D is meant for temporary output intended to be removed before check-in
    70  func D(format string, a ...interface{}) {
    71  	stderrLogger.D(format, a...)
    72  }
    73  

Build version go1.17.8.
